name: Misty Valley Inn B&B

reviews.title: Rude proprietor
reviews.text: From my car, I called the B&B before arriving to reconfirm my reservation and to say that an additional person would be staying in my room. The woman who answered the phone told me that maybe I "would be happier staying somewhere else," which as you can imagine surprised me. Huh?? Then she told me the extra guest could stay "on a cot" but that the price would be increased by $40! Was I hearing this right?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I tried to ask for her reasoning for the price difference, she shouted at me, "YOU NEED TO STOP TALKING!" Wow, I've never come across someone so extraordinarily rude in all my travels. Needless to say, I stayed someplace else and was MORE than happy to do so. Maybe she was having a bad day or something, but based on this phone call, obviously I would suggest staying away from this place. WOW!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.liked: — Very nice romms and great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderfull place to stay and to eat. Very nice rooms. The owners are most helpful. The morning views are breath taking. Well located to meet any needs. Close to the forest, beach, or high country.
reviews.title: Fantastic breakfasts, great scenery

reviews.text: This hidden gem has quite possibly the best breakfasts I've ever had at a B&B (seemed like a gourmet brunch!). Daily wake-ups with a choice of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate were a nice treat too. The owners were wonderful hosts, and were very flexible about breakfast start times. They're also very knowledgeable about where to go in or around the Park. This actually would be a 5-star review, except there was a slight odor in our room. Overall, though, I would highly recommend the Misty Valley Inn!
reviews.title: Wonderful Service, lovely view

likes.disliked: — The property is a bit dated, but well maintained. That quality did not diminish my experience.

reviews.text: A girlriend and I stayed at the Misty Valley Inn during a Washington Peninsula road trip. We both felt very welcomed and comfortable at this property. The owners Rachel and Jim have wonderful experience in the B & B business, and the greater Olympic Peninsula area. The rooms and property were very clean and comfortable, and breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful, friendly B&B

reviews.text: Wonderful deck with lots of local flora and fauna & great views of the valley. Wonderful dessert buffet available throughout our stay. Absolutely fabulous breakfast choices, presentation, service and more service. The wake up tray with hot chocolate was an unexpected special treat. Just loved the whole thing.
reviews.title: Fabulous B&B

likes.liked: — Great food and accommodation in a friendly, comfortable setting. Just perfect!
likes.disliked: — Can't think of a thing. It was all good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very, very enjoyable experience. Can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Excellent time!

likes.liked: — clean, beautiful and go for the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hosts, the Bennett's were very gracious and informative. We greatly enjoyed visiting with the guests and hosts. My wife and I both loved our "Irish Room", which was tastefully decorated and dedicated to one fo the Bennett ancestors. Though we missed seeing the frequent elk visitations, the many birds feeding just outside the dining room window kept us enthralled during breakfast. Many pics were taken! The food: We had the omellet and strawberry crepe for breakfast (out of 6 or so offerings) and they were excellent! Go for the food! Mrs. Bennett is a teacher in culinary arts and it shows. We look forward to returning next time we are in the Forks area.
reviews.title: Wonderful bed-and-breakfast

likes.liked: — The attention to detail and guest preferences

reviews.text: The view out over the valley is spectacular, our hosts were friendly and helpful, the food (your choice of several breakfast entries) was beyond excellent— and to top that, Misty Valley adds services you don't find in every bed and breakfast. The sideboard always stocked with coffee and homemade desserts was a pleasant surprise. The hot tub with a view was very welcome after days of hiking. And the morning wakeup tray of coffee at our door was a real luxury. We were able to set the time of the wakeup tray and also our time to sit down for breakfast . The Bennetts really go the extra mile for each guest.
reviews.title: Quiet and friendly place, fantastic breakfast

reviews.text: We had a very nice stay at Misty Valley Inn in August 2007. The place is quiet, though our bedroom was on the highway side of the house - thankfully very quiet at nigh -. The bedroom are decorated with a nice but not very professionial touch: this is a B&B, you feel like you are staying at some friend's place, not an international hotel.
reviews.title: Great place to bring out of state guests!
Great !
reviews.text: My wife and I had a wonderful staying at Misty Valley Inn. We were visiting the Olympic National Park, and Forks was close to the beaches and the Hoh rain forest. The host Jim warmly welcomed us on a cold night, and we had warm freshly baked chocolate chip cookies as we as hot drinks. The B&B is very clean, wonderfully decorated, and has beautiful details. The Dutch Room is spacious and has a terrific view of the valley in the morning. Breakfast was great! We had a number of dishes to choose from, and was full and satisfied, ready for a day of hiking in the park. We felt welcomed and pampered during our stay, and the hospitality of the host is first class. Highly recommend this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Misty Valley Inn based on the reviews from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The location was great, not too far from various beaches and the Hoh rain forest.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jim was a great host and made us feel like visiting family rather than hotel guests. We stayed in the Dutch room and we had a great view of the valley which was very nice during the morning coffee. The breakfast was great, so were the previous evening's oatmeal chocolate chip cookies. Ah the good life.
reviews.title: Great stay after backpacking in the Olympics

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great B&B

likes.disliked: — would have preferred a king size bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fantastic experience all around!
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where do I begin? This could possibly be the best place I ever stayed. We began our 4 night stay after a 14 hour drive and immediately were made to feel at home. Rachel, the inkeeper and chef (master chef in my opinion) walked us through the procedures and policies of the inn and then had us choose our meal for the next morning. When the food was brought to the table the guests oohed and aahed. The presentation was special and the taste was delicious. When asked by the waitress if she could get him anything else, one of the guests said, "Another stomach, please!" The food was delicious and plentiful. This is only a four room inn, so we felt special being there. And we were treated like we were the most important guest they ever had. I highly recommend this inn to anyone who wants to be pampered and see some of the most beautiful scenery there is to be seen. Olympic National Park is a great place and we found that 4 days was not enough to explore it all. We will probaply be back in the future. Guess where we will stay?
reviews.title: Pampering in Forks, WA? Believe it!

reviews.text: We stayed two nights at Misty Valley. Our host seemed to be "baching it" - but he was great. So friendly and helpful in terms of places to visit - best trails, beaches, etc. We loved the dessert bar - actually didn't even go out to dinner the first night we arrived, just snacked on lemon bars and chocolate cake!
reviews.title: Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of all the B and B's we stayed in during a 2 1/2 week trip to Oregon, this was the best value and the one where we felt the most comfortable. The breakfasts were massive and delicious - you get to choose the night before - every detail of what you want - so it's something to look forward to, for sure! And because they are cooked to order, you can make your own choices. There is no "meat" involved - so this is a great place for vegetarians and for the rest of you, you'll just have to go elsewhere for bacon, I guess. The view off the deck was lovely - enjoyed watching birds and chipmunks. Our rooms were clean and comfortable - no complaints there at all. For the price, this B and B couldn't be beat! We didn't see any vampires, though, but I guess that was a relief!
reviews.title: Two Nights In Forks=One Night Too Many

likes.disliked: — The town in which it's located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My bad for booking two nights in Forks. We could have done everything we'd intended to do in a single day and, frankly, there isn't much doing there (they roll up the sidewalks at 5:00 p.m.!). But I'm not writing to take a shot at Forks...
reviews.title: Don't overlook this great B&B!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a very nice stay at the Misty Valley Inn. Our hosts were personable and helpful. As several prior reviewers have noted, the dessert "sideboard" was terrific. Rachel bakes a serious black forest cake--yummy! We stayed in the Dutch Room, with its private deck and awesome valley view (you'd swear you were looking at a French impressionist painting). We missed out on the elk, too--oh, well. The room was spacious and nicely appointed--it even had two sinks in the bathroom (always appreciated).
reviews.title: great place!

description: Unexpected Elegance in the Mist of the Sol Duc River Valley! Magnificent view of Sol Duc River Meadows. Inn breakfast choices: Apple Souffle, Irish Waffles, Strawberry Crepes, French Toast or Moroccan Omelet. Evening tea or coffee with desserts. Breakfast time is selected by guests. Wake up beverages are delivered to your door. Four guest rooms, with private baths, central area, baby grand piano, and rose garden spa. Located near Hoh Rain Forest and Ocean beaches.
